pages.title: Welcome to StoryPic Kids!
pages.description:
Welcome! This guide will walk you through everything you need to know as a parent.

You'll learn how to:
- Set up child profiles
- Create and manage characters
- Help your child create stories
- Turn stories into beautiful storybooks
- Order printed books

Let's get started!

pages.title: The Parent Dashboard
pages.description:
This is your **Parent Dashboard** - your home base for managing everything.

From here, you can:
- Select which child will be playing
- Access the navigation menu for all features
- Switch between parent and child modes

pages.title: Navigation Menu
pages.description:
The **navigation menu** gives you quick access to all parent features:

- **Children** - Manage child profiles
- **Characters** - Create story companions
- **Storybooks** - View all created books
- **Orders** - Track print orders
- **Settings** - Account & security

pages.title: Managing Children
pages.description:
Let's visit the **Children** page where you manage child profiles.

Each child gets their own profile with:
- A display name and photo
- Personality traits (likes & dislikes)
- Voice settings for read-aloud features
- Their own library of stories and books

pages.title: Adding a New Child
pages.description:
Click the **Add New Child** button to create a profile.

You'll be asked to provide:
- Their name (and pronunciation for read-aloud)
- Pronouns (he/him, she/her, they/them)
- A photo (optional but recommended for AI illustrations)
- Things they love and things they don't like

These details help create personalized stories!

pages.title: Child Profile Details
pages.description:
Here's a demo child profile. Notice the key elements:

- **Avatar/Photo**: Used by AI to create illustrations
- **Likes & Dislikes**: Shape story themes and content
- **Voice Settings**: Control read-aloud preferences

You can edit any profile by clicking on it.

pages.title: Managing Characters
pages.description:
Now let's look at **Characters** - the friends and companions in your child's stories!

Characters can be:
- Real pets (dogs, cats, etc.)
- Imaginary friends
- Family members
- Stuffed animals
- Any special companion!

pages.title: Creating Characters
pages.description:
To add a new character:

1. Click **Add New Character**
2. Choose which child they belong to
3. Add their name, type (pet, friend, etc.)
4. Upload a photo for AI illustrations
5. Add personality traits

Characters will appear in story options when that child plays!

pages.title: The Storybooks Library
pages.description:
The **Storybooks** page shows all books created by your family.

From here you can:
- View any child's storybooks
- Open books to read or edit
- Check the status of art generation
- Access print ordering options

pages.title: Storybook Status
pages.description:
Each storybook shows its current status:

- **Text Ready**: Story text is complete
- **Generating Art**: AI is creating illustrations
- **Art Ready**: Illustrations are complete
- **Print Ready**: Ready for ordering

Click any book to open it!

pages.title: Inside a Storybook
pages.description:
When you open a storybook, you'll see the main viewer with:

- Page-by-page story text
- Generated illustrations (when complete)
- Action buttons for reading, printing, and more

This is where you prepare books for printing!

pages.title: Storybook Actions
pages.description:
The action buttons let you:

- **Generate Art**: Create AI illustrations for each page
- **Read**: Open the book reader view
- **Print Layout**: Prepare the book for printing

Art generation typically takes a few minutes per page.

pages.title: Print Layout Setup
pages.description:
When you're ready to print, click **Print Layout** to:

1. Choose a print size (A4, Letter, etc.)
2. Arrange pages for professional printing
3. Add cover designs
4. Preview the final layout

This creates a print-ready version of your book!

pages.title: Managing Print Orders
pages.description:
The **Orders** page tracks all your print orders.

You can see:
- Order status (processing, shipped, delivered)
- Tracking information
- Order history
- Payment status

pages.title: Parent Settings
pages.description: Finally, let's look at **Settings** where you manage your account.

pages.title: Setting Up a PIN
pages.description:
The **PIN** feature protects parent-only areas.

When set, children will need to enter the PIN to:
- Access parent settings
- Make purchases
- Edit profiles

This keeps little hands from making accidental changes!

pages.title: User Menu
pages.description:
The **user menu** (top right) gives quick access to:

- Switch to parent view
- Sign out
- Access settings
- Toggle diagnostic tools (for troubleshooting)

pages.title: Starting a Story Session
pages.description:
Now let's see how stories are created!

When a child is selected, they see their **Child Dashboard** with three main options:

- **New Story**: Start creating a new adventure
- **My Stories**: View stories in progress
- **My Books**: See completed storybooks

pages.title: New Story Option
pages.description:
Clicking **New Story** starts the story creation journey.

Your child will:
1. Choose a story type (adventure, bedtime, etc.)
2. Select characters to include
3. Answer fun questions about the story
4. Watch their personalized story come to life!

pages.title: My Stories Library
pages.description:
**My Stories** shows all stories this child has created.

Stories can be:
- Read again anytime
- Turned into storybooks
- Shared with family members

pages.title: My Books Library
pages.description:
**My Books** contains all the illustrated storybooks.

From here, children can:
- Read their books with beautiful illustrations
- Listen to stories read aloud
- Watch animated page turns

pages.title: You're All Set!
pages.description:
Congratulations! You now know the basics of StoryPic Kids.

**Quick Reference:**
- **Children page**: Add/edit child profiles
- **Characters page**: Create story companions
- **Storybooks page**: Manage all books
- **Orders page**: Track print orders
- **Settings**: Security & account options

Have fun creating magical stories with your children!

pages.title: Welcome, Young Storyteller!
pages.description:
This guide shows you the magical journey your child takes when creating stories.

We'll follow along from:
- Starting a new story
- Making choices that shape the adventure
- Reading the finished story
- Creating a beautiful storybook

Let's see the magic!

pages.title: The Child's Dashboard
pages.description:
When your child logs in, they see their own special dashboard!

It's designed to be simple and fun with big, colorful cards:

- **New Story** - Start a fresh adventure
- **My Stories** - Continue or re-read stories
- **My Books** - View illustrated storybooks

pages.title: Starting a New Story
pages.description:
Clicking **New Story** begins the creative journey!

Your child will be guided through fun, interactive choices that shape their unique story.

pages.title: Choosing a Story Type
pages.description:
First, your child picks what kind of story they want:

- **Adventure** - Exciting quests and discoveries
- **Bedtime** - Calm, cozy stories for nighttime
- **Funny** - Silly stories full of giggles
- **Learning** - Educational adventures

Each type creates a different mood and style!

pages.title: Picking the Story Mode
pages.description:
Next, they choose how to create the story:

- **Wizard Mode**: Answer guided questions (best for younger kids)
- **Chat Mode**: Have a conversation with the AI storyteller

Both create wonderful personalized stories!

pages.title: The Story Wizard
pages.description:
In **Wizard Mode**, your child answers fun questions:

- Who should be in the story? (themselves, pets, friends)
- What's the setting? (forest, space, underwater)
- What happens? (find treasure, make friends, solve a mystery)

The AI uses these answers to craft a unique tale!

pages.title: Selecting Characters
pages.description:
Your child picks who appears in their story!

They'll see:
- Themselves (using their profile photo)
- Their characters (pets, friends you've created)
- Special guest characters

Selected characters become the stars of the adventure!

pages.title: Story Generation
pages.description:
Once all choices are made, the AI gets to work!

Your child sees a fun animation while their personalized story is being written. This usually takes about 30 seconds to a minute.

pages.title: The Finished Story
pages.description:
The completed story appears with:

- A unique title based on the adventure
- Personalized text featuring your child's name
- Their chosen characters woven throughout
- A satisfying beginning, middle, and end

pages.title: Reading the Story
pages.description:
Now for the fun part - **reading**!

Your child can:
- Read the story themselves
- Have it read aloud (AI voice or browser TTS)
- Follow along with highlighted text

The read-aloud feature is great for bedtime!

pages.title: Read to Me Feature
pages.description:
The **Read to Me** button activates voice narration.

You can configure this in the child's Voice Settings:
- Choose AI voice or browser voice
- Adjust speaking speed
- Set it to auto-start when opening stories

pages.title: Creating a Storybook
pages.description:
After reading, your child can turn their story into an illustrated **storybook**!

Click **Create My Book** to start the process.

pages.title: Choosing an Output Type
pages.description:
First, select what kind of book to create:

- **Picture Book**: Traditional storybook layout
- **Comic Book**: Panel-style illustrations
- **Memory Book**: Scrapbook-style pages

Each has a unique visual style!

pages.title: Selecting Art Style
pages.description:
Next, choose the **illustration style**:

- **Watercolor**: Soft, painterly look
- **Digital Art**: Bright and modern
- **Cartoon**: Fun and expressive
- **Storybook Classic**: Traditional children's book style

The AI will create all illustrations in this style!

pages.title: Art Generation
pages.description:
The AI now creates beautiful illustrations for each page!

This is the longest step - each image takes about 30-60 seconds. Your child can watch the progress or come back later.

pages.title: The Finished Storybook
pages.description:
When complete, your child has a beautiful illustrated storybook!

They can:
- Flip through the pages
- Read with illustrations
- Show off to family and friends

pages.title: Reading the Storybook
pages.description:
The **Read** button opens an immersive book reader:

- Full-screen illustrations
- Page-turn animations
- Read-aloud narration
- Perfect for bedtime reading!

pages.title: Watching the Book
pages.description:
In the book reader, your child experiences their story like a real book:

- Swipe or click to turn pages
- Beautiful full-page illustrations
- Their name and characters throughout
- Optional background music

pages.title: My Books Library
pages.description:
All completed storybooks appear in **My Books**.

Your child can:
- Re-read favorites anytime
- Show off their collection
- Pick which ones to print!

pages.title: Printing a Real Book
pages.description:
The best part? You can turn digital books into **real printed books**!

As a parent, you can:
1. Open the storybook
2. Click Print Layout
3. Configure the print settings
4. Order a professionally printed book

Imagine your child holding their own published book!

pages.title: The Complete Journey
pages.description:
And that's the complete story journey!

**Summary:**
1. Child picks story type & characters
2. AI creates personalized story
3. Child reads (or listens to) their story
4. Choose illustration style
5. AI generates beautiful artwork
6. Read the finished storybook
7. Optionally print a real book!

Every story is unique and special, just like your child.

pages.title: Welcome, Story Writer!
pages.description:
Welcome to the StoryPic Kids content creation system!

As a **Writer**, you have access to powerful tools for:
- Designing story types and templates
- Configuring AI prompts and behavior
- Creating output formats (books, poems, etc.)
- Managing image styles and print layouts
- Testing AI story generation

Let's explore your creative toolkit!

pages.title: The Admin Dashboard
pages.description:
This is the **Admin Dashboard** - your central hub for content management.

The dashboard is organized into sections. As a Writer, you have access to:

- **Story Editor** - Design story types and prompts
- **Data Management** - Manage profiles and assets
- **Testing & Development** - Test your creations

pages.title: Story Editor Section
pages.description:
The **Story Editor** is your main workspace!

It contains four key areas:
- **Story Types** - Define adventure templates
- **Story Phases** - Configure the story flow
- **Prompt Configs** - Control AI behavior
- **Output Types** - Design final deliverables

Click the tabs to switch between them.

pages.title: Story Types Overview
pages.description:
**Story Types** define the different kinds of adventures children can create.

Each story type includes:
- A name and description
- Age-appropriate level bands
- Story arc templates
- Associated prompt configurations

Examples: Animal Adventure, Magical Friend, Big Feelings

pages.title: Creating a Story Type
pages.description:
When creating a story type, you'll configure:

- **Title & Description**: What the child sees when selecting
- **Level Bands**: Age ranges (3-5, 6-8, 9-12)
- **Arc Template**: The story structure steps
- **Status**: Draft or Live

Story types in 'Draft' won't appear to users.

pages.title: Story Phases
pages.description:
**Story Phases** control the flow of story creation.

The main phases are:
- **Warmup**: Introduction and character selection
- **Story Beat**: The interactive story building
- **Ending**: Story conclusion and wrap-up

Each phase has configurable choice counts and ordering.

pages.title: Prompt Configurations
pages.description:
**Prompt Configs** are the heart of AI behavior!

For each phase and level band, you configure:
- **System Prompt**: AI personality and rules
- **User Prompt Template**: Input structure
- **Model Settings**: Which AI model to use
- **Temperature**: Creativity level (0-1)

Good prompts create magical stories!

pages.title: Writing Effective Prompts
pages.description:
Tips for great prompts:

1. **Be specific** about tone and style
2. **Include age-appropriate** language guidance
3. **Define guardrails** for content safety
4. **Use placeholders** like `{{childName}}` for personalization
5. **Test extensively** with different scenarios

Small prompt changes can dramatically affect output!

pages.title: Output Types
pages.description:
**Output Types** define what gets created from a story.

Current output types include:
- **Picture Book**: Traditional illustrated storybook
- **Poem**: Rhyming verse version
- **Coloring Pages**: Black and white illustrations
- **Audio Script**: Optimized for text-to-speech

Each has its own image generation settings.

pages.title: Output Type Configuration
pages.description:
When configuring an output type:

- **Name & Description**: What users see
- **Image Prompt**: AI instructions for illustrations
- **Default Print Layout**: Associated print template
- **Display Image**: Preview image for selection

You can generate display images directly from the admin!

pages.title: Data Management Section
pages.description:
The **Data Management** section lets you manage content assets.

You can access:
- **Children & Characters**: View user-created profiles
- **Story Sessions**: Monitor active story creation
- **Help Wizards**: Create in-app tutorials
- **Image Styles**: Design illustration styles
- **Print Layouts & Products**: Configure printing options

pages.title: Image Styles
pages.description:
**Image Styles** define how AI generates illustrations.

Each style includes:
- **Name**: What users see (e.g., "Watercolor")
- **Prompt Suffix**: Added to all image prompts
- **Preview Image**: Example of the style
- **Status**: Draft or Live

Styles dramatically change the look of storybooks!

pages.title: Print Layouts
pages.description:
**Print Layouts** control how storybooks are formatted for printing.

Layout settings include:
- **Page Size**: A4, Letter, Square, etc.
- **Margins & Bleed**: Print-safe areas
- **Text Positioning**: Where text appears on pages
- **Image Placement**: Full-page, half-page, etc.

Good layouts create professional-looking books!

pages.title: Print Products
pages.description:
**Print Products** define what can be ordered.

Product configuration includes:
- **Name & Description**: Customer-facing info
- **Mixam Specifications**: Print vendor settings
- **Pricing**: Cost calculation rules
- **Page Count Limits**: Min/max pages

Products connect layouts to the printing service.

pages.title: Help Wizards
pages.description:
**Help Wizards** are the interactive tutorials you're seeing right now!

You can create wizards that:
- Guide users through features
- Highlight specific UI elements
- Navigate between pages automatically
- Include markdown-formatted text

Great for onboarding and feature discovery!

pages.title: Testing Your Work
pages.description:
The **Testing & Development** section helps you validate your creations.

Available tests:
- **Story Beat Test**: Test story continuation
- **Story Arc Test**: Test overall structure
- **Story Compile Test**: Test final assembly
- **AI Flow Logs**: View execution details
- **Run Traces**: See prompts, outputs, and costs

pages.title: Story Beat Testing
pages.description:
The **Story Beat Test** lets you:

1. Select a story type and level band
2. Provide sample context
3. Run the AI generation
4. Review the output quality

This is essential for tuning your prompts!

pages.title: Run Traces
pages.description:
**Run Traces** show detailed AI execution logs.

For each generation, you can see:
- The exact prompts sent to AI
- The raw AI responses
- Token usage and costs
- Timing information

Invaluable for debugging prompt issues!

pages.title: Regression Tests
pages.description:
**Regression Tests** ensure your changes don't break things.

The test suite covers:
- API endpoint functionality
- Data access patterns
- Security rule validation

Run these after making significant changes!

pages.title: Story Designer Overview
pages.description:
The **Story Designer** page provides a visual overview of all your story configurations.

It shows relationships between:
- Story types
- Prompt configs
- Output types
- Level bands

Great for understanding the big picture!

pages.title: You're Ready to Create!
pages.description:
Congratulations! You now understand the writer's toolkit.

**Quick Reference:**
- **Story Types**: Define adventure templates
- **Story Phases**: Configure story flow
- **Prompts**: Control AI behavior
- **Output Types**: Design deliverables
- **Image Styles**: Create visual styles
- **Print Layouts**: Format for printing
- **Testing**: Validate your work

Go create amazing stories for kids!

pages.title: Welcome, Administrator!
pages.description:
Welcome to the StoryPic Kids administration system!

As an **Admin**, you have full access to:
- All writer/content tools
- User and role management
- System configuration
- Print order management
- Diagnostics and logging
- Database tools

This guide covers the admin-specific features.

pages.title: Admin Dashboard Overview
pages.description:
The **Admin Dashboard** has 6 main sections:

1. **System Maintenance** - Users & Orders
2. **Story Editor** - Content creation
3. **Data Management** - Profiles & assets
4. **Testing** - AI flow testing
5. **System Configuration** - Settings & tools
6. **Diagnostics** - Logging & debugging

Let's explore the admin-only sections!

pages.title: System Maintenance Section
pages.description:
The **System Maintenance** section is admin-only.

It provides access to:
- **Users**: Manage accounts and roles
- **Print Orders**: Process and track orders

This is where you handle operational tasks.

pages.title: User Management
pages.description:
The **Users** page lets you manage all accounts.

For each user, you can:
- View their profile and email
- Toggle **Admin** role
- Toggle **Writer** role
- See token usage statistics
- View their created content

Roles determine dashboard access levels.

pages.title: Role Permissions
pages.description:
Understanding role permissions:

**Parent** (default):
- Create and manage their children's content
- Order printed books

**Writer**:
- All parent features
- Story Editor access
- Data Management access
- Testing tools

**Admin**:
- All writer features
- User management
- System configuration
- Diagnostics & logging

pages.title: Print Order Management
pages.description:
The **Print Orders** page shows all book orders.

Order workflow:
1. **Pending**: Awaiting approval
2. **Approved**: Ready for submission
3. **Submitted**: Sent to print vendor
4. **Shipped**: In transit
5. **Delivered**: Complete

You can filter by status and manage individual orders.

pages.title: Order Details
pages.description:
For each order, you can view:

- Customer information
- Book details and page count
- Shipping address
- Payment status
- Print vendor (Mixam) reference
- Status history

Click an order to see full details and take actions.

pages.title: System Configuration Section
pages.description:
The **System Configuration** section controls platform behavior.

It includes:
- **Database Tools**: Direct data access
- **AI Prompts**: System-wide prompt settings
- **Kids PWA**: Mobile app configuration

Changes here affect all users!

pages.title: Database Manager
pages.description:
The **Database Manager** provides direct Firestore access.

You can:
- Browse any collection
- Query and filter documents
- View document details
- Delete documents (carefully!)

⚠️ Use caution - changes are immediate!

pages.title: Global Prompt Prefix
pages.description:
The **Global Prompt Prefix** is added to ALL AI prompts.

Use it for:
- Safety instructions
- Brand guidelines
- Universal behavior rules
- Content restrictions

This affects every story generated on the platform!

pages.title: Kids Flow Selection
pages.description:
The **Kids Flows** page controls which story modes are available.

You can enable/disable:
- **Wizard Mode**: Guided questions
- **Chat Mode**: Conversational
- **Gemini 3**: Specific AI model
- **Gemini 4**: Newer AI model

Disabled flows won't appear to users.

pages.title: Upload JSON Configs
pages.description:
The **Upload** page lets you bulk import configurations.

Supported imports:
- Prompt configurations
- Story type definitions
- Image style presets

Useful for migrating settings between environments!

pages.title: Diagnostics Section
pages.description:
The **Diagnostics & Logging** section helps with troubleshooting.

You can toggle:
- **Diagnostics Panels**: Show debug info system-wide
- **Client Logging**: Browser console output
- **Server Logging**: Backend logs
- **AI Flow Logging**: Genkit execution logs
- **API Documentation**: Expose API docs endpoint

pages.title: Enabling Diagnostics
pages.description:
When to enable each option:

- **Diagnostics Panels**: General debugging
- **Client Logging**: Frontend issues
- **Server Logging**: API/backend problems
- **AI Flow Logging**: Story generation issues
- **API Docs**: Developer access needed

Remember to disable after debugging!

pages.title: AI Flow Logs
pages.description:
The **AI Logs** page shows detailed execution traces.

For each AI call, you see:
- Input prompts
- Output responses
- Token counts
- Execution time
- Any errors

Essential for debugging story generation issues!

pages.title: API Documentation
pages.description:
When enabled, **/api-documentation** provides:

- List of all API endpoints
- Request/response formats
- Authentication requirements
- Example payloads

Useful for developers and integrations.

pages.title: Mixam Catalogue
pages.description:
The **Mixam Catalogue** shows available print options.

Browse:
- Paper types and weights
- Binding options
- Cover materials
- Size specifications
- Pricing tiers

Use this when configuring print products.

pages.title: Background Tasks
pages.description:
The **Tasks** page shows background job status.

Monitor:
- Image generation queues
- PDF compilation jobs
- Batch processing tasks
- Failed job retries

Useful for troubleshooting stuck operations.

pages.title: Deleted Items Recovery
pages.description:
The **Deleted Items** page shows soft-deleted content.

You can restore:
- Children profiles
- Character profiles
- Storybooks

Items remain recoverable until permanently purged.

pages.title: Create Test Data
pages.description:
The **Create Data** page generates sample content for testing.

You can create:
- Test child profiles
- Sample characters
- Demo story sessions

Useful for development and QA testing.

pages.title: Security Best Practices
pages.description:
Admin security reminders:

1. **Limit admin accounts** - Only trusted team members
2. **Use writer role** for content creators
3. **Monitor user activity** regularly
4. **Disable diagnostics** in production
5. **Review API access** periodically
6. **Backup before** major changes

You have powerful access - use it wisely!

pages.title: You're Fully Equipped!
pages.description:
Congratulations! You now understand all admin capabilities.

**Admin-Only Quick Reference:**
- **Users**: Manage accounts & roles
- **Print Orders**: Process book orders
- **Database**: Direct data access
- **Global Prompts**: System-wide AI rules
- **Kids Flows**: Enable/disable modes
- **Diagnostics**: Debugging tools
- **Tasks**: Background job monitoring

Keep the platform running smoothly!
